item.title: Avenue Supermarts shares skyrocket 15% as company's revenue in Q3 surges 17.5% YoY; check other details - Upstox
item.description:
Avenue Supermarts Shares Surge 15% Following Strong Q3 Revenue Growth

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: PTI

Avenue Supermarts, operators of DMart, saw a 15% increase in share prices after announcing significant revenue growth for Q3 FY25.

  • Shares rose to ₹4,152.75 on the NSE.
  • Standalone revenue for Q3 FY25 was ₹15,565.23 crore, up 17.49% YoY.
  • Total number of stores increased to 387 with 10 new additions this quarter.
“Overall, H1 FY 2025 like-for-like revenue growth was 7.4% for 2 years and older stores.” - Neville Noronha, CEO & Managing Director

This robust growth reflects Avenue Supermarts' strong market presence and operational success, indicating positive trends in the retail sector.

item.title: IRFC shares in focus after MoU with REMCL to finance renewable energy projects - The Economic Times
item.description:
IRFC Shares Jump 3% on Signing MoU with REMCL to Finance Renewable Energy Projects

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Economic Times

Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) shares increased by 3% following the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Railway Energy Management Company Ltd (REMCL) to finance renewable energy projects aimed at powering Indian Railways.

  • IRFC will explore financing options for renewable, thermal, and nuclear power projects.
  • The collaboration aims to help Indian Railways achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2030.
  • REMCL will leverage its expertise in energy procurement while IRFC will contribute its financial expertise.
  • The partnership represents a strategic shift for IRFC towards diversifying its business model.
“This MoU sets the foundation for cooperation between IRFC and REMCL to advance Indian Railways' goal of minimizing reliance on fossil fuels.”

Overall, this collaboration highlights a commitment to environmentally sustainable solutions in transportation.

item.title: REC, PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says - CNBCTV18
item.description:
REC, PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says

Date: Jan 3, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm Emkay Global has initiated coverage on shares of state-run power financing companies REC Ltd. and Power Finance Corporation (PFC), assigning both a 'Buy' rating.

  • Emkay has set a price target of ₹650 for REC and ₹600 for PFC, suggesting potential upsides of 25% and 31%, respectively.
  • Both REC and PFC have decreased more than 20% from their record highs in July 2024.
  • Emkay cites sustained double-digit loan growth and strong asset quality as key factors for their positive outlook.
“The controlled upcycle in power capital expenditure and lending is here to stay, and both REC and PFC offer an optimal pathway to capitalise on this trend.”

The brokerage projects robust growth for both firms, driven by strong credit demand and favorable economic conditions.

item.title: REC and PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says - CNBCTV18
item.description:
REC and PFC Shares Expected to Rise by Up to 31%, Says Emkay

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Brokerage firm Emkay Global has initiated coverage on shares of state-run power financing companies REC Ltd. and Power Finance Corporation (PFC), assigning both a 'Buy' rating.

Emkay has set a price target of ₹650 for REC and ₹600 for PFC, implying a potential upside of 25% and 31%, respectively, from Thursday's closing levels.

  • REC and PFC are down over 20% from their record highs.
  • Emkay's optimistic outlook is based on long-term capital expenditure plans in the sector.
  • Valuations remain reasonable despite higher estimates when considering growth potential.
“Sustained double-digit loan growth and improving asset quality support robust earnings visibility for companies in the sector.”

The brokerage anticipates strong credit demand and robust earnings, despite players trading at a discount to their book values.

item.title: Blinkit launches 10-minute ambulance service in Gurgaon - The Times of India
item.description:
Blinkit Launches 10-Minute Ambulance Service in Gurgaon

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Blinkit has introduced a new 10-minute ambulance service in Gurgaon, aimed at providing rapid medical assistance to patients in emergencies.

  • The service is designed to address the critical need for timely medical intervention.
  • Blinkit aims to leverage its existing logistics network to facilitate quick access to ambulances.
  • This initiative could significantly reduce emergency response times and potentially save lives.
  • The service is available via the Blinkit app for quick booking.
“This service underscores our commitment to innovation in the healthcare space.” - Blinkit CEO

The introduction of this service marks an important step towards ensuring better healthcare access in urban areas.

item.title: Stocks to buy: Ankush Bajaj recommends three stocks for today—3 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Ankush Bajaj Recommends Three Stocks for January 3, 2025

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Stock Market News

The Indian stock market ended on a positive note, with notable gains observed in the auto, IT, and consumption sectors. The Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both reported significant increases, although the Nifty Media sector saw declines.

  • The Nifty 50 closed at 24,188.65.
  • The BSE Sensex climbed 1.83% to settle at 79,943.71.
  • The Nifty Media sector lagged behind, closing in the red.

item.title: ITC demerger record date: TODAY! Last date to BUY to get ITC Hotels shares FREE - ET Now
item.description:
ITC Demerger Record Date: Last Chance to Buy Shares for Free ITC Hotels Shares

Updated: January 3, 2025, Source: ET NOW News

January 3 is the last date to buy ITC shares to qualify for ITC Hotels shares. With the ex-date falling on January 6, investors must act before January 4-5, when markets will be closed.

  • ITC shares must be bought by January 3 to qualify for ITC Hotels shares.
  • Pre-open session for price discovery on January 6, 2025, at 9:00 AM.
  • ITC Hotels will continue within indices for three trading days post-demerger.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held.
  • Market experts predict varying target prices for ITC shares, with some reaching upwards of Rs 575.
“ITC will continue to hold 40% stake in ITC Hotels which should be seen as a positive for shareholders.” - Amnish Aggarwal, Head - Research, Prabhudas Lilladher

The impending ITC Hotels demerger is poised to benefit both sectors and shareholders, showcasing strategic value creation within ITC Ltd.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment on January 3: Here’s how to check status on BSE and registrar website - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment on January 3: Here’s how to check status on BSE and registrar website

Publication Date: January 2, 2024 — Source: CNBC TV18

How to Check Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status

Indo Farm Equipment Ltd. will finalize the allotment of its Initial Public Offering (IPO) on Friday, January 3. The company’s shares are scheduled to debut on the BSE and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on January 7. The IPO, which opened for subscription from December 31 to January 2, witnessed robust demand, with an overall subscription of 227.57 times by the end of the final day.

  • The price band was set at ₹204-215 per share.
  • The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) segment was subscribed 242.40 times.
  • Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) saw a subscription of 501.65 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed to their allocated portion 101.64 times.

Investors who bid for this mainboard issue can check the allotment status via the official websites of BSE, NSE, and the registrar. Shares will be credited to successful applicants' demat accounts on January 6, and refunds will be processed for those who did not receive allotments.

About Indo Farm Equipment

Indo Farm Equipment, founded in 1994, is a leading manufacturer of tractors and agricultural equipment, reporting ₹375 crore in revenue and ₹15.5 crore in net profit for fiscal year 2024.

item.title: New Kia Syros Bookings Now Open Ahead Of Launch In February - CarDekho
item.description:
Kia Syros Bookings Open, Launch On February 1, 2025

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CarDekho.com

Kia has opened bookings for the new Syros SUV with a token amount of Rs 25,000 ahead of its launch on February 1, 2025.

  • Bookings for the Kia Syros are open.
  • It slots between the Sonet and Seltos in Kia's line-up.
  • Available in six variants: HTK, HTK (O), HTK Plus, HTX, HTX Plus, HTX Plus (O).
  • Engine options include a 1L turbo petrol and a 1.5L diesel.
  • Features include ventilated seats, dual 12.3-inch screens, and ADAS.
  • Expected pricing starts at Rs 9.7 lakhs (ex-showroom).

The Kia Syros will be showcased at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, with deliveries expected soon after the launch.

“Kia is offering the Syros with various segment-first features, ensuring a competitive edge in the market.”

Overall, the Kia Syros is positioned as an exciting new entry in the SUV segment, blending modern features with competitive pricing.

item.title: Tata Motors, three other shares get added to CLSA India model portfolio; HDFC Bank out - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Tata Motors, three other shares get added to CLSA India model portfolio; HDFC Bank out

Publication Date: Not available Source: CNBC TV18

CLSA has made adjustments to its India focus portfolio by adding Tata Motors and three other companies while removing HDFC Bank due to recent market performance and economic predictions.

  • Tata Motors, NTPC, Nestle India, and Britannia have been added to the model portfolio.
  • HDFC Bank has been removed following a downgrade of the bank sector's outlook.
  • CLSA noted that Tata Motors has shown a 35% decline in its share price from its peak, factoring in potential risks.
  • The additions occurred due to corrections in stock prices, presenting a buying opportunity according to CLSA.
“Less severe trade restrictions may attract inflows into EMs like China, which could make India underperform in a broader EM rally led by laggards.”

In conclusion, CLSA's revised focus on stocks reflects an adaptation to current economic conditions and anticipated market movements for 2025.

item.title: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today — 3 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today — 3 January 2025

Date: 3 January 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Despite a downturn in the Asian stock market, the Indian stock market showed resilience with significant gains. Sumeet Bagadia of Choice Broking offers his insights into current market trends and recommends five stocks for investors.

Sumeet Bagadia's breakout stock recommendations

  • The Nifty 50 index rose by 425 points, closing at 24,168.
  • The BSE Sensex increased by 1,385 points, ending at 79,893.
  • Bagadia recommends a bullish outlook with a focus on breakout stocks for intraday trading.
  • Five shares recommended for buying include Apollo Micro Systems, Reliance Infrastructure, DCX Systems, FSL, and Transformers and Rectifiers (India).
“Nifty today can be assumed in a broader range of 23,850 to 24,250.” - Sumeet Bagadia

The recommended stocks and their details are as follows:

  • Apollo Micro Systems: Buy at ₹123.96, target ₹133, stop loss ₹119.
  • Reliance Infrastructure: Buy at ₹322.65, target ₹345, stop loss ₹311.
  • DCX Systems: Buy at ₹393, stop loss ₹355.
  • FSL: Buy at ₹394.50, target ₹422, stop loss ₹380.
  • Transformers and Rectifiers (India): Buy at ₹1230, target ₹1300, stop loss ₹1186.

Disclaimer: The views and recommendations made above are those of individual analysts or broking companies and not of Mint. We advise investors to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market showed significant gains, with the Sensex rising by 1,436 points and the Nifty 50 advancing by 446 points. Strong performances in the IT and auto sectors contributed to this rally.

Key Points:

  • The Sensex surpassed 80,000 points, and the Nifty 50 crossed 24,200.

item.title: Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Jan. 3 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Jan. 3

Date: 03 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The stock market showed positive momentum as Indian benchmarks closed higher for the second consecutive day. The NSE Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex recorded significant gains while foreign portfolio investments resumed after a selling streak.

  • NSE Nifty 50 closed up 445.75 points (1.88%) at 24,188.65
  • BSE Sensex rose by 1,436.30 points (1.83%) to 79,943.71
  • Asian markets also saw positive trade with South Korea's Kospi leading gains.
  • The Indian Rupee weakened slightly against the US Dollar, closing at 85.75.
  • Foreign investors purchased stocks worth approximately Rs 1,506.75 crore.
"The NSE Nifty 50 closed 445.75 points or 1.88% up at 24,188.65 and the BSE Sensex ended 1,436.30 points or 1.83% higher at 79,943.71."

This positive trend suggests a bullish outlook for the markets going into the trading session on January 3, 2025.

item.title: Jeff Bezos' $500M Yacht hit with surprise raid as Lauren Sánchez's sunbathing gets interrupted by customs officers - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Surprise Customs Check Interrupts Bezos' Yacht Day

Date: Jan 03, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

While Lauren Sánchez was sunbathing aboard Jeff Bezos' $500 million yacht, customs officers conducted a surprise inspection, causing a brief interruption on New Year's Eve.

  • Customs officials boarded the yacht for a routine inspection that lasted approximately three hours.
  • Lauren Sánchez appeared unbothered, engaging with friends during the check.
  • Jeff Bezos was not present during the customs inspection.
  • Speculation about a lavish New Year’s Eve wedding was denied by Bezos.
“This whole thing is completely false — none of this is happening,” Bezos stated regarding the wedding rumors.

The unexpected customs check added an unusual twist to what was planned as a luxurious day on the high seas.

item.title: Scamster Ketan Parekh back in Sebi net, banned from market - The Times of India
item.description:
Ketan Parekh Banned from Market by Sebi

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Ketan Parekh, a notorious figure in Indian stock market history, has found himself once again in the regulatory spotlight as he faces a ban from the market imposed by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi). This development highlights ongoing concerns about market manipulation and investor protection.

  • Parekh is a key figure in a major stock market scam that erupted in 2001.
  • The ban comes amidst efforts by Sebi to clean up the financial markets and safeguard investor interests.
  • Parekh is accused of stock price manipulation and fraudulent trading activities.
  • This renewed scrutiny raises questions about the integrity of the Indian financial system.
“We are committed to ensuring a fair and transparent trading environment in the stock market,” said a Sebi spokesperson.

This action against Parekh signals a stricter regulatory approach to market misconduct, aiming to enhance overall market integrity.

item.title: Explained: How in-flight Internet works - The Indian Express
item.description:
Explained: How in-flight Internet works

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: Indian Express

Air India has announced the rollout of Wi-Fi Internet connectivity services on domestic and international flights serviced by select aircraft, making it the first airline in India to provide in-flight Internet.

  • Wi-Fi will be available for free on select domestic flights for a limited period.
  • Plans to extend the service to other aircraft in the fleet are underway.
“Air India is the first airline in India to offer Internet connectivity on domestic flights.”

This initiative reflects Air India's commitment to enhancing passenger experience and connectivity during flights.

item.title: Kekius Maximus falls as Elon Musk swaps X avi - crypto.news
item.description:
Kekius Maximus Falls as Elon Musk Swaps X Avi

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: crypto.news

The Kekius Maximus meme coin on Ethereum and Solana experienced a significant drop following Elon Musk's change of his profile photo and X page name. After a brief surge in popularity, the value of Kekius Maximus plummeted drastically.

  • Kekius Maximus launched on December 14 and saw a market cap reach $380 million.
  • The token surged over 30-fold before crashing to $0.07 amidst Musk's social media changes.
  • Copycat tokens on Solana also collapsed as interest waned.
  • Musk clarified that the name change was to address pressing U.S. issues.
“We have now confirmed that the explosion was caused by very large fireworks and/or a bomb carried in the bed of the rented Cybertruck and is unrelated to the vehicle itself.” — Elon Musk

Some early investors in Kekius Maximus saw significant returns, but many did not realize profits before the crash.

item.title: UPI hits record with ₹16.73 billion in transactions worth ₹23.25 lakh crore in December 2024 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
UPI Reaches Milestone with Record 16.73 Billion Transactions in December 2024

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)

December 2024 saw Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions hitting a record 16.73 billion, reflecting an 8% rise from November's figures.

  • Total transaction value in December reached ₹23.25 lakh crore, up from ₹21.55 lakh crore in November.
  • The average daily transaction count was 539.68 million, compared to 516.07 million in November.
  • NPCI extended the deadline for compliance with UPI volume cap guidelines to December 2026.
  • Only two apps, PhonePe and Google Pay, dominate over 85% of UPI transactions.
"Considering various factors, the timeline for compliance of existing TPAPs, who are exceeding the volume cap, is extended by two years, i.e., till December 31, 2026," - NPCI

This record underscores the growth of digital payments in India, particularly through UPI, which continues to be a favorite among users.

item.title: Apple's voice assistant Siri under fire for privacy breach, tech giant to pay $95 million to settle lawsuit | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Apple’s voice assistant Siri under fire for privacy breach, tech giant to pay $95 million to settle lawsuit

Publication Date: Recently filed in court

Source: Live Mint

Apple has agreed to pay $95 million to settle a lawsuit that claims its Siri assistant violated users' privacy by recording conversations without consent.

  • The lawsuit was filed in Oakland, California federal court and is awaiting approval.
  • Complaints arise from accidental activations of Siri leading to recordings of private conversations and third-party disclosures.
  • Class period spans from September 17, 2014, to December 31, 2024.
  • Affected individuals could receive up to $20 for each Siri-enabled device.
  • Apple denies any wrongdoing.
  • Lawyers for plaintiffs may request up to $28.5 million in fees from the settlement.
The $95 million settlement equates to about nine hours of profit for Apple.

This settlement highlights ongoing concerns about privacy and the operation of voice-activated assistants.

item.title: Why the US dollar is so strong to start the year - ForexLive
item.description:
Why the US dollar is so strong to start the year

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Forexlive

The US dollar is the top performer as it surges at the start of 2025, outperforming major currencies like the euro and pound. This performance is driven by strong capital flows toward US assets, with US equity markets vastly outperforming others.

  • The US dollar is up more than 1% against the euro and pound.
  • The recent economic news included initial jobless claims and soft data on construction spending and manufacturing sentiment.
  • Capital flows are the main driver of the dollar's strength, with significant investment occurring in US markets.
  • There are risks such as tariffs and fiscal policies that could affect the markets.
  • Investors see a big opportunity when markets shift, similar to Argentina's market performance after political changes.
“The short answer is that right now the US and US companies are not just winning, but they're running up the score.”

The US dollar's strong performance is a result of sustained capital flows and market dynamics, with potential risks ahead that could impact the trend.
